intro: Neoporteria tuberisulcata, commonly known as the tuberous sedge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowering spikes produce small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Neoporteria tuberisulcata is often found in marshy or poorly drained soils and is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
